page.title: 17S/N - Village Events
page.content: Events in the two villages tend to be for fund-raising - for church, village hall, a village organisation or some outside charity. Support is given readily on the day, though help with preparations is sometimes harder to find. Northorpe fetes (for church, chapel or playground) are held at Northorpe Manor and at the Old Rectory and at Scotton an annual fete is held (at Manor Farm) in aid of village hall funds. Both villages have held success -ful "Bygones" Weekends Scotton's run by the WI who have also held two very popular Craft Weekends, in conjunction with a Flower Festival at the church. A Mowers' Supper is held each year in Scotton as the PCC's way of thanking those who keep the churchyard tidy (regular motor mowing and two hand cuts - with sycthes). There is usually also some form of Harvest Supper.
